page.title: 03Gunton Park And Gardens
page.content: Although under cultivation,Gunton Park today is much as the landscape artist of the 19th century planned.The principal Hanworth entrance built by Samuel Wyatt,the imposing Tower entrance to the east (Gilpin 1820), Elderton Lodge,now a hotel and Suffield Lodge have been restored to their origanal style,as have smaller lodges and cottages. Though sold or let most of the buildings within the park are listed as of architectural and historical importance -Grade 2.The park is designated a conservation area in the County Plan. The 2 lakes and informal parkland gardens designed by Bridgman, Repton and Capability Brown, all surrounded by a belt of mixed woodland make Gunton Park an area of great natural beauty abounding in wild life..
